revised_title: Oviviviparous Shark Breeding and Aeration of Fetal Blood
tldr: The author examines the reproductive process of the oviviviparous shark, focusing on the aeration of fetal blood in different animal classes. They describe the internal anatomy and organs of the male and female sharks, as well as the development and hatching of eggs. The study provides insights into the breeding habits of sharks and the similarities between oviviviparous and oviparous dogfishes.
